answers.answer: Do a web search on "dumping syndrome".  When the stomach empties to the small intestine faster than it should, it can cause the symptoms you describe.  This problem can be evaluated with a simple and painless gastric emptying study.

question: Hello.  I hope someone here can offer some insight.  I'm 36, overweight - previously tested negative for diabetes (a year or so ago) and had a clear endoscopy a few years ago.  I've recently had new symptoms, about 25 minutes after I eat something really sweet or a large amount of food I get extremely lightheaded, have never passed out, and then I immediately need to use the bathroom - almost like after you've taken a laxative.  I've noticed this lightheadedness is not constant, it seems to come on more if I haven't eaten in a while.  I had a clear cardiac workup recently because of a complicated pregnancy last year.  I also had an incident where I was out walking, drank some cold water on an empty stomach and had the same lightheadedness?  Any advice please?
title: Lightheaded after eating
